alert.note: Alert for Banks; Madison (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Banks and northwestern Madison Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Banks Crossing, or near Commerce, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Banks and northwestern Madison Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
